job_description:
Position Overview

The Department of Physics & Astronomy in the Faculty of Science invites applications for a Aerospace/Mechanical Engineer. This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 36 months (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension.

The Radiation Impacts on Climate and Atmospheric Loss Satellite (RADICALS) is a research satellite to study high-energy particles from nearby space hitting Earth's upper atmosphere. It will have a payload of four scientific instruments, including the X-Ray Imager (XRI) that will be built at the University of Calgary. The RADICALS-XRI Aerospace/Mechanical Engineer will play a leading role in the design, assembly, integration, and testing of the XRI instrument.

The position will report to the XRI Instrument Lead, and the successful candidate will be expected to work with other members of the XRI team including the RADICALS-XRI Electrical Engineer, the larger RADICALS project team (mostly at the University of Alberta and University of Calgary) and external contractors and stakeholders including the satellite bus provider. The position involves some travel, mostly in support of instrument integration and launch, but also for project meetings and training. The successful candidate will be expected to work with DC high voltage systems, vacuum systems, and sealed radiation sources, and will be expected to meet tight deadlines.

The primary purpose of this position is to design, manufacture, integrate and test the mechanical systems for the XRI instrument. The Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for detailed design work including creating CAD models of the parts and assemblies, selecting materials for vacuum and radiation environments (including adhesives and polymerics), structural analysis and thermal analysis. They will also be responsible for instrument assembly and testing, including thermal vacuum testing and vibration testing using in-house and outsourced facilities, and for supporting the mechanical integration of the instrument with the satellite bus. The Mechanical Engineer will also be responsible for developing and maintaining formal documentation including instrument specification documents, design documents and test/qualification reports under the direction of the Instrument Lead and the RADICALS Project manager. They will be expected to prepare presentations and/or present the designs at various project reviews, and to contribute to reviewing other instrument designs. They will be required to liaise with internal and external stakeholders and contractors, including the RADICALS Project Office, industrial contractors for quality assurance and bus integration, internal and external manufacturers and machine shops, environmental testing facilities, and the Canadian Space Agency.

Position Description

Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):

Design and analyze the XRI mechanical systems, including creating and adapting CAD models, selecting and procuring materials, and performing structural and thermal modelling and simulation.
Oversee manufacturing and assembly of the instrument.
Plan and perform environmental tests of the instrument (radiation, thermal/vacuum, vibration).
Support the integration of the instrument with the satellite bus.
Develop and maintaining formal documentation including instrument specification documents, design documents and test/qualification reports.
Contribute to project reviews by preparing presentations and/or presenting the designs, and by contributing to reviewing other instrument designs.

Qualifications / Requirements:
Canadian citizen or permanent resident, eligible for Controlled Goods Program clearance.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
3+ years of experience in designing mechanical systems for aerospace or related applications.
Proficient in CAD tools including SolidWorks.
Strong knowledge of materials and structural analysis.
Experience with thermal design and analysis.
Understanding of vibration and shock analysis and testing.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with vacuum systems, preferred.
Knowledge of polymerics for space applications, preferred.
Experience with testing and verification of mechanical systems for space applications, preferred.
Familiarity with radiation shielding, preferred.
